page.title: 11EDUCATION IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content:
There were originally small village schools in the area, but now there is only one serving the locality.
In Diggle, there was a school at Kiln Green. In Uppermill the first school dates back to Medieval times, when it was situated in the chancel of the Church.There was a Victorian building in Lee Street, in the Saddleworth Fold hamlet (present Church Street). This was the original St. Chad's school, which opened in 1860 & that building was closed in 1883. The school became known as "Saddleworth Parochial", its official name being Saddleworth Parochial (C.E.) Controlled Junior & Infant School, until September, 1985, when it was renamed St. Chad's C.E. Primary School. The present building was constructed in 1961, in Rhodes Avenue, in the new housing estate.
